alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 19 at 1:32PM PDT until March 22 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * CHANGES...Delayed the start time of the Winter Storm Watch for Tuesday. * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Additional snow accumulations up to 6 inches, except 8 to 12 inches above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph, except near 70 mph across the ridges. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, except 8 to 18 inches above 7000 feet possible. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 AM PDT Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Snowfall may exacerbate snow load concerns for mountain communities. Travel could be difficult over mountain passes. Gusty winds will cause hazardous boating conditions on Lake Tahoe. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow may turn to rain this afternoon below 6500 feet.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
